attributes.action: Allow those already in the UK switching to care visa to bring dependants
attributes.additional_details: Care workers play a crucial role in supporting the UK’s health and social care system. Many have left families behind and face emotional distress due to separation. Denying dependants for in-country applicants is unfair and affects our well-being and job performance. Allowing family reunification would boost morale, retention, and show appreciation for our hard work and dedication. We urge the Government to support care workers by amending this policy.
attributes.background: We urge the Government to allow care workers already in the UK switching to a Health and Care Worker visa to bring dependants. Care workers have families, and separation affects their well- being. At least let those in the UK reunite with their families, acknowledging their vital contributions.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions, which call for similar action: 

Allow care workers to bring their families to the UK
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/716517 

Allow dependents to stay if someone switches to care visa
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/709341
